issue.title: [Err] [Plugin.hh:180] Failed to load plugin libStaticMapPlugin.so: libStaticMapPlugin.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

content.raw: You may need to upgrade your Gazebo version, that plugin is only available from 7.11.0: #!/osrf/gazebo/annotate/gazebo7/Changelog.md?at=gazebo7&fileviewer=file-view-default#Changelog.md-135
content.html: You may need to upgrade your Gazebo version, that plugin is only available from 7.11.0: #!/osrf/gazebo/annotate/gazebo7/Changelog.md?at=gazebo7&fileviewer=file-view-default#Changelog.md-135

issue.title: [Err] [Plugin.hh:180] Failed to load plugin libStaticMapPlugin.so: libStaticMapPlugin.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

content.raw: ok fine. but i have also tried gazebo 9. did it get the plugin in a later version? can somebody push a newer version into the ROS repository?
content.html: ok fine. but i have also tried gazebo 9. did it get the plugin in a later version? can somebody push a newer version into the ROS repository?

issue.title: [Err] [Plugin.hh:180] Failed to load plugin libStaticMapPlugin.so: libStaticMapPlugin.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

content.raw:
I mentioned Gazebo 7 because that was the version on the issue. For Gazebo 9, the plugin was added on 9.1.0: #!/osrf/gazebo/annotate/gazebo9/Changelog.md?fileviewer=file-view-default#Changelog.md-204

You can install it with these instructions:

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_ubuntu&cat=install#Alternativeinstallation:step-by-step
content.html:
I mentioned Gazebo 7 because that was the version on the issue. For Gazebo 9, the plugin was added on 9.1.0: #!/osrf/gazebo/annotate/gazebo9/Changelog.md?fileviewer=file-view-default#Changelog.md-204

You can install it with these instructions:

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_ubuntu&cat=install#Alternativeinstallation:step-by-step

content.raw:
I was following this tutorial [http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=static\_map\_plugin&cat=build\_world](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=static_map_plugin&cat=build_world) and got this error, when running _**gazebo --verbose static\_map\_plugin.world**_

```
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 9.11.0
Copyright (C) 2012 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

[Msg] Waiting for master.
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 9.11.0
Copyright (C) 2012 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 10.4.53.227
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 10.4.53.227
[Err] [Plugin.hh:187] Failed to load plugin libStaticMapPlugin.so: libStaticMapPlugin.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
[Wrn] [Publisher.cc:141] Queue limit reached for topic /gazebo/default/user_camera/pose, deleting message. This warning is printed only once.
```

Can you please help me with this.. thank you!

‌

‌

issue.title: [Err] [Plugin.hh:180] Failed to load plugin libStaticMapPlugin.so: libStaticMapPlugin.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

content.raw: If you installed gazebo from Ubuntu packages, you might be missing the `gazebo9-plugin-base` package. It should be automatically installed when installing gazebo, but maybe it got accidentally removed?
content.html: If you installed gazebo from Ubuntu packages, you might be missing the gazebo9-plugin-base package. It should be automatically installed when installing gazebo, but maybe it got accidentally removed?

issue.title: [Err] [Plugin.hh:180] Failed to load plugin libStaticMapPlugin.so: libStaticMapPlugin.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

content.raw: Thank you for the response, It's great to hear from another Ethiopia. So, should I re-install Gazebo? Or is there any other way to install the plugin in with out re-installing Gazebo.
content.html: Thank you for the response, It's great to hear from another Ethiopia. So, should I re-install Gazebo? Or is there any other way to install the plugin in with out re-installing Gazebo.

issue.title: [Err] [Plugin.hh:180] Failed to load plugin libStaticMapPlugin.so: libStaticMapPlugin.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

content.raw:
> It's great to hear from another Ethiopia

Likewise!

> So, should I re-install Gazebo?

You can try `sudo apt-get install gazebo9-plugin-base`.
content.html:
It's great to hear from another Ethiopia

Likewise!

So, should I re-install Gazebo?

You can try sudo apt-get install gazebo9-plugin-base.
